skill.name: ui-ux-pro-max
skill.description: UI/UX design intelligence. 50 styles, 21 palettes, 50 font pairings, 20 charts, 8 stacks (React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, Tailwind). Actions: plan, build, create, design, implement, review, fix, improve, optimize, enhance, refactor, check UI/UX code. Projects: website, landing page, dashboard, admin panel, e-commerce, SaaS, portfolio, blog, mobile app, .html, .tsx, .vue, .svelte. Elements: button, modal, navbar, sidebar, card, table, form, chart. Styles: glassmorphism, claymorphism, minimalism, brutalism, neumorphism, bento grid, dark mode, responsive, skeuomorphism, flat design. Topics: color palette, accessibility, animation, layout, typography, font pairing, spacing, hover, shadow, gradient.
skill.summary: UI/UX design intelligence with 50 styles, color palettes, font pairings, and framework-specific guidelines.
skill.author: nextlevelbuilder

security_audit.summary: All 910 static findings are false positives. The scanner incorrectly flagged hexadecimal color codes (#2563EB) as weak cryptographic algorithms, documentation URLs as hardcoded URLs, and legitimate UI/UX terms like 'debounce' as keylogger keywords. The skill contains only design data (styles, palettes, typography, frameworks) and has no network calls, file system access, or credential handling.

content.value_statement: Building user interfaces requires finding the right style, colors, and layout patterns. This skill provides a comprehensive database of 50 design styles, 21 color palettes, 50 font pairings, and framework-specific guidelines to create professional interfaces.
actual_capabilities: Generate UI designs with 50+ design styles including glassmorphism, brutalism, neumorphism, and bento grids
Create color palettes with hex codes for primary, secondary, CTA, background, text, and border colors
Provide font pairings from Google Fonts with heading and body font combinations
Deliver framework-specific guidelines for React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, and Tailwind CSS
limitations: Does not generate complete application code or implementation files
Does not create custom graphics, icons, or image assets
Does not perform accessibility audits on existing code
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma or Sketch

use_cases.title: Frontend Development Design Guidelines
use_cases.description: Get design recommendations and framework-specific guidelines when building user interfaces for web or mobile applications

use_cases.title: Design Inspiration for Product Interfaces
use_cases.description: Explore design styles, color palettes, and typography pairings to find inspiration for new product interfaces

use_cases.title: Design System Documentation
use_cases.description: Find appropriate UI patterns and component structures when documenting design systems and component libraries

prompt_templates.title: Basic Landing Page Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [style] style landing page for a [product_type] using [framework]
prompt_templates.description: Simple request for a landing page with specific style and framework

prompt_templates.title: Dashboard Design with Specifications
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a [product_type] dashboard with [color_scheme] colors, [font_pairing] fonts, and [chart_type] charts using [framework]
prompt_templates.description: Detailed dashboard request with color palette, typography, and chart specifications

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Hybrid Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [product_type] with [style1] and [style2] hybrid styling, including color palette with [primary_color] as primary, [secondary_color] as secondary, typography pairing [heading_font] and [body_font], accessibility-compliant [component] components, and framework guidelines for [framework]
prompt_templates.description: Comprehensive design request with multiple style blending and detailed specifications

prompt_templates.title: Full Application Interface Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete [product_type] application interface including: 1) Landing page with [style1] style and brand colors, 2) Dashboard with [chart_type] visualizations and [color_scheme] theme, 3) Mobile-responsive [component] components using [framework] best practices, 4) Typography system with [font_pairing], 5) Accessibility features following WCAG guidelines. Include framework-specific code patterns, component hierarchy, and state management approach.
prompt_templates.description: Full application interface design with multiple views, components, and implementation guidance

output_examples.input: Create a glassmorphism style landing page for a SaaS product using React and Tailwind CSS
output_examples.output: Landing page structure with hero section, features, and CTA using Tailwind CSS with glassmorphism style
output_examples.description: Landing page structure with hero section, features, and CTA using Tailwind CSS with glassmorphism style

output_examples.input: Generate a color palette for a SaaS application with professional tones
output_examples.output: Color palette with primary blue (#2563EB), secondary teal (#14B8A6), coral CTA (#F97316), and neutral grays for a SaaS application
output_examples.description: Color palette with primary blue, secondary teal, coral CTA, and neutral grays for a SaaS application

output_examples.input: Recommend font pairing for a modern web application
output_examples.output: Font pairing using Inter for headings (700 weight) and Open Sans for body text (400 weight) with 16px base size
output_examples.description: Font pairing using Inter for headings and Open Sans for body text with 16px base size

best_practices: Start by identifying the product type and industry to narrow down appropriate design styles from the database
Use the framework-specific guidelines to ensure code patterns match your chosen technology stack
Consider accessibility requirements by selecting color combinations that meet WCAG contrast ratios
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing more than two conflicting design styles without a clear visual hierarchy
Do not use decorative fonts for body text as they reduce readability
Avoid ignoring framework-specific conventions as they help maintain code consistency

faq.question: How do I choose the right design style for my project?
faq.answer: Start by identifying your product type, target audience, and industry. Each design style in the database includes recommendations for appropriate use cases and examples of products that use that style.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for mobile app design?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes guidelines for React Native, Flutter, and SwiftUI frameworks with mobile-specific component recommendations and responsive design patterns.

faq.question: How does this skill help with accessibility?
faq.answer: Design styles include accessibility ratings and color palettes provide contrast ratio information. Framework guidelines include ARIA attribute recommendations and semantic HTML patterns.

faq.question: What output formats does this skill provide?
faq.answer: The skill provides design specifications including color codes, font names, CSS patterns, and framework-specific code examples. It does not generate complete files or project structures.

faq.question: How are the design styles categorized?
faq.answer: Styles are categorized by era, complexity, and primary use case including general styles, landing page styles, and BI/analytics dashboard styles.

faq.question: Does this skill work with design systems?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides component guidelines, typography systems, color tokens, and framework-specific patterns that align with design system architecture.
